semantic_identifier: Impact--Follow-up workflow: Fix contact coverage calculation used for multi-threading prompts.docx

hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Follow-up workflow: Fix contact coverage calculation used for multi-threading prompts.docx

sections.text:
This change improves the accuracy of the “contact coverage” signal that determines whether follow-up multi-threading prompts should fire for a given account or opportunity. Today, coverage can become stale or incorrect due to CRM sync timing, contact merges, or opportunity stage changes, which causes prompts to be skipped when they’re needed or shown when they’re not relevant.

By correcting the backend coverage calculation (roles/personas mapping, active-contact qualification, and engagement recency), we’ll trigger multi-threading prompts based on the true state of who is engaged and who is missing in the buying group. This should increase prompt precision and user trust, because the workflow will align with what sellers actually see in the CRM and in recent activity.

The primary user impact is better prompt reliability: fewer false negatives (missing prompts that would help expand stakeholders) and fewer false positives (nudges that suggest contacts already covered or not applicable). For the business, this supports higher adoption of the follow-up workflow and increases the likelihood that sellers add/engage the right contacts at the right time, improving downstream conversion and deal progression.

We’ll also add lightweight telemetry around the coverage inputs and computed outputs to validate eligibility decisions in production and quickly spot regressions. This instrumentation will enable faster debugging across edge cases (syncs, merges, stage transitions) and provide a measurable baseline for prompt quality improvements post-release.
